segments.text: you're rather energetic today . What's going on ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: nothing really . I think I've had a few too many coffees .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: free coffee is one of the perks at this place , isn't it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: it's the only perk of this job ! How's your day going ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: not that well . I've got that Monday morning feeling today .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: my boss has been breathing down my neck all day . I can't wait for the weekend !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: your boss is a real salve-driver , isn't he ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: you can say that again ! He won't even let us check our personal email at work !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that's not just your boss . No one is allowed to send personal emails from the office .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: really ? I didn't know that it was against company policy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: maybe your boss isn't so horrible after all !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: no , he is . Some bosses will bend the rules a bit sometimes , but not my boss . He always follows the rules to a T .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: try not to let it bother you too much .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: thanks . I better get back to my work before my boss yells at me again !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: ok , I'll see you in a bit .
segments.speaker: S2
